column4: from what I've read in the forums, the default ndiswrapper should work for that card.
- what do you mean? that doesn't seem to match with the nidswrapper instructions on the site, explain?
the instructions are written for specific .inf file, but you can substitute the proper .inf for your driver
Instructions here http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=25683 but substitute in the proper .inf file name for your driver.
if that doesn't work, you'll need to compile ndiswrapper from source.  But compiling from source will prevent you from installing updates to the linux-image package
- how do I find the correct .inf file for my wireless card?
- yeah, and it gives that message, operation not permitted
apparently it's not uncommon.  But I really don't know why that happens
- a google search reveals a few people who've had it, but no solution. Does anyone know about modprobe ndiswrapper 'giving operation not permitted'?
have you tried running everything (carefully) thru a root-terminal?
it causes problems later on with updating linux-image (kernel) packages, but you may need to compile ndiswrapper from source
- I'm going to try another card, D-Link DWL-650+, it is detected at wlan0 but seems unsupported, ifup does not activate it
